intro: Acronema chienii, commonly known as the Chinese acronema, is a flowering plant species native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. Acronema chienii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
